meanings.definition: relating to or located in the medulla
meanings.sent1: The medullary region of the brain controls basic functions like breathing.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed out the medullary area on the scan.
meanings.sent3: The medullary soup was so bland, it put everyone to sleep at the dinner party.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a medullary quality, deep and resonant like a bell.
meanings.sent5: The medullary glow of the night sky was mesmerizing, like a blanket of stars above.

meanings.definition: resembling or characteristic of the medulla
meanings.sent1: The medullary pattern on the leaf looked like tiny veins.
meanings.sent2: His medullary reflexes kicked in when he heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The medullary clouds in the sky seemed to form funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her medullary thoughts were deep and introspective, like a well of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The medullary scent of pine trees filled the forest, calming all who entered.
